chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Irwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery to Emergency Rescue Worker, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(7)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.  Fees, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent. 
Defendant is take any medications prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.

timeConds.notes: Defendant was granted 136 days credit for tme served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
